repo.name: incubator-heron
repo.description: Apache Heron (Incubating) is a realtime, distributed, fault-tolerant stream processing engine from Twitter

title: Overwrite TMasterLocation and SchedulerLocation when exist in LocalFileStateManager
body:
Overwrite TMasterLocation and SchedulerLocation when exist in LocalFileStateManager
1. Unlike Zk statemgr, we overwrite the location even if there is already one.
   This is because when running in local mode we control when a tmaster dies and
   comes up deterministically.
   Also, it can allow tmaster and scheduler to restart after failures
2. Add unit tests.

title: Add support for loading python deps via pypi
body:
Partially fixes #628 by adding ability to load python deps via pypi. Instead of relying on eggs, `pex_library` and `pex_binary` can now declare deps via `reqs = "pyyaml==3.10"`.

A few things left to do:
1. Verify that bazel build still invoked python properly by others since we now point to `/usr/bin/python`.
2. Verify the python cli works when built this way
3. Verify that the pex manifest is correct
4. Testing in Twitter CI by sed'ing the pypi uri with the internal twitter repo uri.

3. the ultimate solution is to make bazel take the python version to host_configuration which is being discussed in bazel user group

repo.description: Apache Heron (Incubating) is a realtime, distributed, fault-tolerant stream processing engine from Twitter

title: stop using 'with open()' to handle files
body:
1. ‘with open() as fd’ is added into python since version 2.5. For older versions like 2.4, this causes syntax error.
2. current bazel doesn’t allow us to chose which exact python version to run for building extra_action rule’s tool attribute. The generated py_binary picks up the /usr/bin/python automatically
3. For any host set python2.4 as default version of python, bazel fails to do the code style check due to the “syntax error”

title: Add python stylechecker
body:
Fixes #577. To test do the following:

```
$ bazel build --config=darwin --experimental_action_listener=tools/python:compile_python heron/cli/src/python/...
```

This uses the default styles (e.g., 4 space indents). We can customize the styles if we don't like them.

title: fail travis build fast if unit test fails
body:
Based on the travis ci doc (https://docs.travis-ci.com/user/customizing-the-build/#Customizing-the-Build-Step), even the build.sh fails, any following script will still be executed.

We changed to make the travis build fail fast if build.sh fails.

title: Provide repeated job link for running topology
body:
Currently, some schedulers can have customized job ui, for instance,
Mesos Slave UI page displaying all scheduled containers. And heron-ui may want this link and display it.
This PR:
1. Adds an interface in IScheduler to return optional job link if there is.
2. Adds repeated job link field in SchedulerLocation and always writes it to state manager.
3. Then other components, for instance, tracker can get job link value by querying state manager.
